intro: Carex marchandiana, commonly known as Marchand's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and clustered inflorescences. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It is valued in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
